summary: Email correspondence between Justin Houston of SigNet Technologies and Hughwon Daniel of the Bureau of Prisons regarding IP address and port submittals for devices at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The exchange is technical in nature, focused on network configuration for an AMS server.

keyFacts: Email correspondence shows technical coordination between SigNet Technologies and the Bureau of Prisons regarding network configuration at MCC New York.
The exchange is dated November 27, 2018, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's 2008 conviction but before his 2019 arrest.
The communication involves IP address and port requirements for programming an AMS server at the correctional facility.
Both parties include standard corporate confidentiality disclaimers in their email signatures.
The document appears to be routine administrative correspondence about facility technical infrastructure.
